title.narrative: Help affected families sustain in COVID-19

description.narrative: Muwakhat Foundation wants to support families affected by COVID-19 and get them back on their feet, so they do not have to depend on others for feeding themselves. This was one of the reasons, Muwakhat provided some of these families with funds and fruits/vegetable carts. Now, Muwakhat will give medicines to the patients testing positive, especially the mothers. Muwakhat believes when the mother is safe, the whole family is safe.

mailing-address.narrative: H # 249 A-1 (Lower Portion) wafaqi colony Lahore 54000 Pakistan

description.narrative: The longer vulnerable children are out of school, the less likely they are to return. While NGOs in Cambodia are able to resume certain daytime activities, public schools will remain closed until the end of the year due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Even though children are encouraged to study through distance learning, many are unable to access it, don't have the right resources, have to work instead or simply lose motivation. COLT supports more than 100 children during the current global crisis.

organisation.narrative: Cambodian Organization for Living and Temporary-care

mailing-address.narrative: #301, Tomnob Prek Thnaut, Baku village, Dangkor Phnom Penh 12401 Cambodia

description.narrative: The Henry Ford is committed to continuing to support the community during the COVID-19 pandemic.

organisation.narrative: The Edison Institute d/b/a The Henry Ford

mailing-address.narrative: 20900 Oakwood Boulevard Dearborn, MI 48124 United States

description.narrative: Our mission is to tell Detroit's stories and why they matter. We are committed to continuing to support the community during the COVID-19 pandemic, in fact, we were made for historic times like these.

mailing-address.narrative: 5401 WOODWARD AVENUE DETROIT, MI 482024009 United States

title.narrative: COVID-19 Relief Fund for Rural India

description.narrative: This project will help the most vulnerable villages in rural areas with 10,000 COVID-19 medicine kits for home isolation and provide food kits for the ones who have lost their livelihood or the sole earner of their family.

mailing-address.narrative: 1 Aricent Ln, Electronic City, Phase IV, Udyog Vihar, Sector 18 Gurugram, Haryana 122011 India

title.narrative: A Digital Solution to Support our COVID19 Response

description.narrative: Since COVID-19 hit the African continent, mothers2mothers (m2m) has rapidly adapted our services to keep our frontline staff and their clients safe and healthy, while continuing to provide them with health services and support, and reach even more clients. As part of our response, m2m developed the Virtual Mentor Mother Platform (VMMP), a new WhatsApp-based interactive tool that enables users to access health information and service referrals on COVID-19 and other health topics in 30+ languages.

mailing-address.narrative: 1431 Broadway 8th Floor New York, NY 10018 United States

title.narrative: Help our school rise again after the pandemic

description.narrative: Malnutrition, and poverty, and now Covid-19, have devastated Burundi, but Murakaza School, is a beacon of hope, as it feeds and educates 320 children from the poorest communities. The school is trying to continue, because it knows that without it, many of the children would be on the streets begging. Help us to put the school back on a secure footing, so it can continue to support them .

organisation.narrative: Bread and Water for Africa UK

mailing-address.narrative: 50 broadway London SW1H 0BL United Kingdom

description.narrative: TLC made the big announcement earlier this year that we would be moving our home to a safer location. Not too long after this the coronavirus pandemic hit the world with full force and, while necessary, has sadly set us back quite a bit. Much of the funds we had reserved for the move were diverted to weathering the severe lockdown restrictions in South Africa, whilst ensuring our little ones maintained their consistency of care. This is why we need your help to Bust That Bond, Baby!

mailing-address.narrative: Plot 136 Bronkhorstfontein Johannesburg, Gauteng 1872 South Africa

title.narrative: Mosaic Youth Theatre Of Detroit COVID-19 Response

description.narrative: Mosaic remains committed to the health and well-being of young artists, our team, and the greater community. In light of recent developments related to COVID-19 and the Governor's Executive Order, Mosaic has transitioned all of its in-person programming to a virtual format. We will continue to communicate through our website, email, and social media channels with updates regarding these programs and any future changes.

mailing-address.narrative: 2251 ANTIETAM AVENUE DETROIT, MI 48207 United States

title.narrative: PROTECT IRAQI CHILDREN: COVID RAPID RESPONSE FUND

description.narrative: Iraq has been hard hit by COVID-19. ICF's "Rapid Response Fund" supports urgent action for orphans, street kids, and other vulnerable children. Across all projects, ICF has already funded 1,379 packages for kids and families in Baghdad, Basra, Mosul, and Erbil. Each package helps feed and provide hygiene supplies for a family of 5 for a week. Funding also supports COVID protection (e.g. masks, etc.) for social workers, teachers, and lawyers who continue to care for kids during COVID.

mailing-address.narrative: PO Box 233 Falls Church, VA 22040-0233 United States

description.narrative: During these uncertain and challenging times, we at PAMA wanted to support Palestinia health agencies by providing much needed personal protective equipment. We committed to supporting Palestine throughout this crisis and we know that you are too. We have seen how, together, PAMA and it's supporters can save lives and we know we can count on you to meet this challenge with us. We share your worries for the citizens of Palestine and pray for the health and safety of every one during this crisis.

mailing-address.narrative: P.O. Box 4132 Manteca, CA 95337 United States

description.narrative: The risks associated with the COVID-19 pandemic have created an emergency situation facing homeless veterans in Pittsburgh. Veterans Place, devoted to the health and well-being of one of our city's most vulnerable populations, has KEPT ITS DOORS OPEN. At a time when many other homeless veterans' support services have closed the Veterans Place, founded in Pittsburgh in 1996, is a shelter from the COVID-19 storm.

mailing-address.narrative: 945 Washington Boulevard Pittsburgh, PA 15206 United States

title.narrative: Provide 100 beds to needy pregnant moms in Africa

description.narrative: We've recently learnt of the plight of our local hospitals during the COVID-19 crisis. We have seen pictures of mothers lying on the floor during labour or waiting days for a C-section, which causes many risks for the mothers and babies. Through this project, we'd like to purchase mattresses and blankets for the many expectant moms queuing the passages waiting to deliver their babies.

mailing-address.narrative: Love Story office, 2 Glen Street, Richmond Hill Port Elizabeth 6001 South Africa

title.narrative: Stand Up With Doman International- Covid-19 Relief

description.narrative: With the spread of Covid-19, the determination of our kids and the hope of our families call you to action! Every person plays a vital role in making a difference for the brain-injured children whom we champion.We ask that you join our community to help make the lives of families we touch around the world significantly better! With your help, we can keep moving forward. Will, you chose to stand with us during this difficult time?

mailing-address.narrative: 1055 Virginia Dr Unit 102 Fort Washington, PA 19034 United States

description.narrative: GRACE Cares will provide much needed relief to communities affected by COVID-19 in conjunction with our local heroes who are leading Project Hearts in the Dominican Republic, the Lucknow Project in India, and Kali to Kali in Rwanda. This initiative will dramatically improve the quality of life and healthcare of the people of the Baitoa region in the Dominican Republic, the Lucknow region in India, and the Kigali region in Rwanda in their struggle against the current pandemic.

mailing-address.narrative: 773 Guilford Street Brattleboro, VT 05301 United States

title.narrative: FEED 150 MOST VULNERABLE FAMILIES IN UGANDA

description.narrative: Uganda's lock down has closed all non-essential businesses & services, as the government ramps up preventative measures to combat Covid-19. The pandemic is affecting the lives of those living in poverty. In response,our organisation is already conducting a short-term food relief, & is starting efforts for long-term relief for rural families in the communities. Your donation to this fund will provide a food relief& support to the families of these communities during this challenging time.

mailing-address.narrative: Bugembe Jinja Katende Road Jinja, Eastern Region 00256 Uganda

title.narrative: Working for children and the pandemic by COVID-19

description.narrative: We seek to strengthen our program of care for children from 0 to 6 years and their families living in violence and poverty and pandemic in Mexico. Our care model has had to be adapted to the contingency situation of COVID-19 and we continue to provide educational-therapeutic care using technological tools, imagination and creativity. With this attention we are fighting family violence, social inequality and providing psychological support to families in these difficult moments.

mailing-address.narrative: Privada Volcan de Colima 2720 Colonia Volcanes Puebla, Puebla 72410 Mexico

title.narrative: Emergency Family Relief Food and Nutrition Support

description.narrative: There are major threats to food systems including conflict, climate shocks, the locust crisis and now the COVID-19 pandemic. The project contributes to sustainable development goal 2 with the aim to provide emergency food support, achieve food security and improved nutrition to most vulnerable families in the informal settlement of Nairobi. We are seeking support to enable us respond to the nutritional needs of children, adolescent girls, pregnant and lactating women, and older persons.

mailing-address.narrative: P.O Box 23686-00625 Kangemi, Nairobi, Nairobi 00625 Kenya

title.narrative: 500 vegetables seed starter- packs for cummunities

description.narrative: This project shall distribute 500 vegetables seed starter- packs to 500 households living in Ha Sekake and neighbouring areas to improve child nutrition for the year commencing October 2020- September 2021 during Covid- 19 pandemic.

title.narrative: COVID-19 Acute Relief and Emergency Support

description.narrative: The newly found COVID-19 is spreading rapidly around the world. Indian Government initially announced country lock down effective from March 24-31, 2020 and was extended till July 31. Mostly, the unorganized sector and daily wage labor, low income citizens are panicked and worried on the front line of crisis. The fund will support immediate and recovery the life of vulnerable communities through awareness, distribution of hygiene kits and nutritious food.

mailing-address.narrative: No . 323 Dr Ambedkar street , Adaiyur village, Tiruvannamalai District, Tamilnadu 606604 India

title.narrative: Heathcare through Mobile Medical Unit in COVID 19

description.narrative: Osmanabad and its adjoining Latur district in the Maharashtra State of India are among the 100 poorest districts in India, as per the Niti Ayog (a policy 'Think Tank' of the Government of India established to achieve SDGs), which lack of adequate health services in the rural village. This project will help to provide preventive and curative care and services at the doorstep of these vulnerable villagers making healthcare accessible to all and also will help to curb the COVID 19 virus locally.

mailing-address.narrative: PRIDE India, Plot No.SF-9,G Block, Next To American School Of Bombay, Bandra Kurla Complex Bandra(East) Mumbai 400098 India

title.narrative: Atzin continues covid19 response in Mexico

description.narrative: Atzin's health promoters - all young women from the community - responded quickly to the threat of covid19. They rolled out a three-part plan starting in mid-March: community education about covid with home visits, street by street; distribution of food packages every two weeks to 600+ families who are most in need; provision of medicines for those with chronic conditions; and, sewing 4,500+ cloth face masks with distribution to families. Despite difficult circumstances, their work continues.

organisation.narrative: Atzin Mexico / Atzin Desarrollo Comunitario AC

mailing-address.narrative: Calle Nogales 17 Colonia Lomas de San Anton Cuernavaca, Morelos 62020 Mexico

description.narrative: COVID-19 forced rapid change in education, with schools migrating quickly online to slow rates of infection. At Nehemia School in Pogradec, Albania, donors on Global Giving contributed to get laptops for our high school teachers. As of February 2021, we still need eight laptops for teachers for lower grades. COVID-19 will not be over anytime soon in Albania, and helping teachers stay connected with their young students during periodic closures will limit disruptions and support learning.

mailing-address.narrative: 1630 30th St Suite A #345 Boulder, CO 80540 United States

title.narrative: Emergency Food Baskets for Ugandan Families

description.narrative: Project Have Hope has always been about creating lasting and sustainable change to create independence. However, the toll of COVID-19 has been too great. In these near desperate times, PHH is seeking to provide assistance to help our artisans and their families cope. Our hope is to provide 80 food baskets to the families most in need in the Acholi Quarter. Additional funds would be used to provide food as needed as the crisis continues.

mailing-address.narrative: PO Box 602 Malden, MA 02148 United States

description.narrative: Conflict in Darfur exposes millions of internally displaced people living in camps, where the majority are women and children, to militia, torture, and rape. Children are especially vulnerable. Many lack shelter and families, and child labor exposes them to trafficking and child soldiering. Their lives are at a higher risk now due to COVID-19 because there is no available healthcare, no quarantine, and no food provided to them.

mailing-address.narrative: 2658 Cold Spring Road Indianapolis, IN 46222 United States

title.narrative: Fund for Children With Cleft in Lebanon/MENA

description.narrative: This fund will provide comprehensive cleft care for underserved children with cleft lip/palate in MENA region during our April mission to Lebanon. More babies are born with cleft in this region than almost anywhere else in the world. All care is provided free of charge so that our patients can overcome the tremendous burden of living with untreated cleft, including social stigma, poor health, malnutrition, and poverty. Funds will help provide medicines, surgical care, and COVID-19 testing.

mailing-address.narrative: 101 Access Road, Suite 205 Norwood, MA 02062 United States

description.narrative: Covid-19 infection is a high risk for cancer patients. We are supporting thousands of cancer patients in Nigeria who cannot afford to buy masks to protect themselves.

mailing-address.narrative: 35A Itafaji Street, Dolphin Estate Ikoyi Lagos 101233 Nigeria

title.narrative: Keep ORS-FM Maasai community radio on-air for all

description.narrative: ORS FM based south of Arusha in Tanzania is the only radio station broadcasting across the whole region in Maa - the language of the Maasai people - as well as in Swahili. More than 1 million people receive their broadcasts. Since many Maasai cannot understand Swahili or English, ORS FM is the only source of reliable, up-to-date information and news for them. This is particularly critical now for updates & advice on COVID - otherwise unavailable in Maa - as well as all their regular programming.

mailing-address.narrative: 15 Lady Place Abingdon, Oxfordshire OX14 4FB United Kingdom

description.narrative: When COVID19 arrived in Kenya, Springs of Hope Foundation shifted its focus from a free vocational training school for vulnerable young women to making facemasks to be given to the most vulnerable in our community. It quickly became apparent that catastrophic food shortages & mass starvation were greater devastations than the virus itself. Since March we have been focusing on a free food hamper & facemask distribution program to the elderly, people with disabilities & child-headed households.

mailing-address.narrative: PO Box 204 Big Bay, MI 49808 United States

title.narrative: COVID19 Home Gardening for 50 Cambodian Families

description.narrative: This project will increase food production and income for 50 most vulnerable families impacted by COVID-19 in the rural community of Cambodia by providing them farming resources including seed and fertilizer to launch their gardens at home.

mailing-address.narrative: P.O. Box 797 Fort Collins, Colorado 80522 United States

description.narrative: South Africa's high youth unemployment was already concerning. COVID-19 made it worse, pushing many young people further into poverty. Due to the lockdown, Afrika Tikkun shifted their training to online platforms, putting many candidates at risk of falling off the program due to lack of access to technology and internet. Your gift will help disadvantaged students access online learning so they can continue their journey towards a bright future.

mailing-address.narrative: 1401 Hillside Rd Wynnewood, Pennsylvania 19096 United States

title.narrative: Feeds 93 children from Mexico during COVID 19

description.narrative: Due to the health contingency, the economy in Mexico is going through a crisis, impacting the well-being of millions of families. In Jalisco, Mexico, preventive measures such as the stop of work activities were promoted, which directly affected the income of families because some industries fired or reduced staff work days. This project will help children and young people of the families that were affected by the work stoppage to face the situation satisfying a basic need: food.

mailing-address.narrative: CALZADA DE LOS FRESNOS No. 47 Col. CIUDAD GRANJA Ciudad Granja Zapopan 45010 Mexico

description.narrative: We will provide vegetable seeds, organic fertilizer and pesticides and training to 3,000 poor households in order for them to start their individual backyard vegetable gardens, remain healthy and well and have steady sources of income and nutrition during this very challenging times.

title.narrative: SUPPORT FOR 100 COVID AFFECTED SMALL BUSINESS

description.narrative: The Covid-19 pandemic situation in Bangladesh seriously affected rural economic activities like small business specially women entrepreneur of agriculture,poultry,fisheries,livestock, grocery,tea stall,vegetable shop, handicrafts sector.They are lost operating capital for fulfilling there essential needs due to long term countrywide lockdown .At this moment they could not start their business due to shortage of working capital.The project will run their business through providing startup fund .

title.narrative: Food Banks and Pantries: Covid Response in Germany

description.narrative: Tafel Deutschland e.V. is the national association of food banks and community pantries in Germany. Our network of over 60,000 volunteers at nearly 950 branches nationwide is working to safely provide food and other resources to around 1.65 million beneficiaries throughout the country, many of whom are especially vulnerable to Covid-19 due to their age or preexisting health conditions along with those impacted by the economic downturn.

mailing-address.narrative: Germaniastr. 18-20 12099 Berlin 12099 Germany

title.narrative: Launch Covid-Proof Education Series for Girls (US)

description.narrative: Bonus Day Project! Creative girls have a hard time fitting into "normal" education systems. Covid-19 added more stressors: isolation, sick family, loss of traditional milestones, etc. So, we're launching an innovative music biz education series accessible by mobile phone! U.S. teens will have a fun, safe learning/community platform with industry experts teaching "real world" lessons. Your donation will help us launch a pilot program so young women can start a career path to success!

mailing-address.narrative: 1604 Gaston Ave Austin, TX 78703 United States

description.narrative: This project located in Mombasa slums will provide meals to 300 children and their families during covid 19 pandemic. In addition the project will seek to offer quality education remotely through providing revision papers to the children . The children are unable to access school facility as a result of government restrictions which have banned learning institutions from operating due to covid 19.

mailing-address.narrative: 117 West 124th Street 5th Floor New York, NY 10027 United States

title.narrative: Fighting hunger in time of pandemic

description.narrative: Hunger is on the rise. In recent months, unemployment and sanitary measures to avoid the spread of COVID-19 have resulted in people not having the possibility of having enough income to cover their basic livelihood. Regrettably, the poverty and hunger crises created by COVID-19 are far from over.

description.narrative: COVID-19 pandemic kept teenagers at home for months! This project will help 200 teenage girls go back to school and help them study at ease with joy because their school fees and study books is free from Fageli foundation.This will help them to study and graduate. This will prevent the usual drop out of this girls from school. This will prevent this girls hawking on the streets to look for funds for school.This project will keep this children busy with learning activities and make them educated.

organisation.narrative: The Fageli good health advocacy & lifestyle foundation

mailing-address.narrative: House 12, 21b road FHA lugbe airport road Abuja FCT Abuja +234/. 900288 Nigeria

title.narrative: Beating Covid-19 with climate change resilience

description.narrative: We help traditional local people who depend on growing their food and some crops to market. We include our 19 Steps Out of Poverty for Subsistence Farmers, teaching how to grow a cost-efficient balanced diet. Since tourism has come to a stop, work allowances and working hours are halved. Covid-19 demands that our crew become business people. Even producing little, they can become sales people which will help to change their mindset. Their extended families include up to 7 children and others.

title.narrative: Covid Relief - Feed 1,200 Struggling Thai Families

description.narrative: As people all over the world are being impacted by the global pandemic, many Thai families are struggling just to have enough food to eat. People are losing hope and the suicide rate is skyrocketing across the nation. This project will provide food and essential supplies to provide relief and sustain the families for a few weeks.

mailing-address.narrative: 397/2 Moo 7 T. Mae Hia Muang, Chiang Mai 50100 Thailand

description.narrative: Partnering with women's community groups, together we're growing seedlings for kitchen gardens for 5,000+ mothers and 15,000+ children while promoting COVID-19 awareness. 100% DIRECT GIVING: 100% OF YOUR DONATIONS IMPROVE FOOD SECURITY FOR WOMEN AND THEIR FAMILIES.

mailing-address.narrative: 100 Maple Park Blvd Ste 130 St Clr Shores, MI 48081 United States

title.narrative: Help Celebrate more 5th Birthdays in Mozambique

description.narrative: In Mozambique, 44% of children under 5 are stunted from chronic illness and malnutrition. COVID-19 further threatens maternal and child health. Join PCI Media in changing this narrative by supporting our work to share vital health information and spark positive behavior changes via radio-the lifeline to the hardest to reach communities. One episode of our radio program, Ouro Negro (Black Gold), reaches 1.5 million people.

mailing-address.narrative: 26 Broadway Suite 934 New York, New York 10004 United States

title.narrative: COVID Relief: Feed children and families in Nepal

description.narrative: With increasing unemployment and rising food costs caused by COVID-19, many families in Nepal are struggling to feed their children. Nutrition Kitchens provide hot meals free-of-charge to children in locked-down communities, and NYF's Lito for Life program prepares and distributes packets of Lito (a "super flour" made of roasted and ground corn, wheat, and soybeans) to Nepalese families living in urban communities.

mailing-address.narrative: 1016 Lincoln Blvd. Suite 222 San Francisco, California 94129 United States

title.narrative: COVID-19 Relief for Women and Children in Nepal

description.narrative: This project provides COVID-19 relief for women and children in Nepal. As per government request, NYF had set up an emergency shelter for women (and their children) experiencing housing insecurity due to the nation-wide lockdown and mandatory quarantine. Now that the lockdown has been lifted, NYF will continue efforts to empower women and children through the pandemic by providing them with access to education.

mailing-address.narrative: 1016 Lincoln Blvd. Suite 222 San Francisco, California 94129 United States

description.narrative: This project will provide monthly supply of food to 200 very poor and marginalized elderly people living in 3 villages. With food supply very scarce nowadays with the Coronavirus pandemic and poor farm harvest due to low soil fertility and pest infestation, hunger is felt by the elderly poor and there is a need to provide them with food from outside sources.

title.narrative: Help women victims of violence during COVID-19

description.narrative: Due to the COVID-19 crisis, the number of calls from women victims of violence who need urgent accommodation or assistance of another kind, most often financial, has increased significantly. In a period of 2 months alone, we did 151 hours of help and support for a total of 70 people. This project will help us to continue providing our maximum support to all beneficiaries of the Counseling "Maja Culic" (accommodation, food, transport, hygiene supplies, psychological and legal assistance, etc.).

organisation.narrative: DOMINE - Organization for Promotion of Women's Rights

mailing-address.narrative: Bosanska 4 Split, Split/Split-Dalmatia County 21000 Croatia

title.narrative: Digital Learning For 1000 Public School Students

description.narrative: This project will bridge gaps in educational enrichment for vulnerable students by providing data for digital learning access, and delivering educational and skills-building programs via digital platforms for up to 1000 secondary school-aged students. Programming will equip participating pupils with information, skills, and resources to support and sustain learning and development, and provide motivation to persist through COVID-19 related school closures in Nigeria.

mailing-address.narrative: 48 Awolowo Rd Ikoyi 23401 Nigeria

title.narrative: Support Korean American Nonprofits During COVID-19

description.narrative: This relief fund will support nonprofit organizations across the U.S. that are on the frontlines helping the most vulnerable people in the Korean American (KA) communities. These constituents of the nonprofits have been negatively affected by the COVID economic downturn. The 3 priority areas include 1) service for low-income senior/elderly Korean American population; 2) mental health/family counseling service for the KA community; and 3) economic support for undocumented families.

mailing-address.narrative: 1875 K Street, NW Suite 400 Washington, DC 20006 United States

title.narrative: Provide relief food & sanitation during covid-19

description.narrative: The project will provide food stuff and sanitation to needy families in Kibera Slums in Nairobi,Kenya. This will go a long way to facilitate provision for 80 vulnerable families who are struggling to make ends meet due to job losses and general lack of opportunities during this pandemic time. Delivering the foodstuff right to their doorstep will avoid them being exposed to covid by having to go to a center of distribution. The sanitation materials will assist to maintain cleanliness in homes.

mailing-address.narrative: 22043 KIBERA Nairobi, Nairobi 00523 Kenya

description.narrative: This project is a kit translated into native languages with playful and educational self-learning tools that allow children to develop skills and knowledge for life. It arises to respond to the educational crisis generated by COVID 19 since poverty and inequality limit access to distance educational content. We will deliver 200 backpacks to the children of 6 vulnerable communities in Oaxaca, Mexico, is a project that promotes multilingualism and advocates respect for cultural diversity.

mailing-address.narrative: reforma 35 Villa Coyoacan CP 04000 mexico 04000 Mexico

title.narrative: Burnout Relief for Healthcare Providers in Mexico

description.narrative: Healthcare professionals are our essential defense on the front lines against deadly infectious diseases such as COVID 19, and they are operating under tremendous strain to provide quality care to a surging number of patients. We aim to protect them from the harmful effects of chronic stress in these trying times by giving them skills to better manage stress and difficult emotions, strengthen their interpersonal relationships, cultivate emotional resilience and improve their mental well-being.

mailing-address.narrative: Avenida Tamaulipas 236 502 Hipodromo, Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, CDMX 06100 Mexico

title.narrative: Support Community Health Workers to Get PPE

description.narrative: The project will offer basic Personal Protective Equipments (PPEs ) supplies such as hand sanitizers, hygienic kits, infrared thermometers, surgical masks and other necessary supplies. With covid-19 it is crucial that Comunity Health Workers (CHWs ) have what they need to protect themselves and the community they serve. In this three-month project we aim to distribute 1500 infrared thermometers and hand sanitizers (one to each CHW) and 30,000 surgical masks.

organisation.narrative: RWANDAN YOUTH DEVELOPMENT AND VOLUNTARY ORGANIZATION

mailing-address.narrative: RWANDA RULINDO DISTRICT RULINDO CITY, NORTHER PROVINCE - Rwanda

description.narrative: The CAMAAY is organizing this fundraiser to provide those affected by conflict in Cameroon with face masks. This will assist in helping vulnerable and marginalized populations in our local communities fight the spread of COVID-19. Funds will be used to purchase materials to create face masks. The estimated cost per mask is $1 CAD. If we raise enough funds to produce a substantial amount of face masks, the cost will also decrease. This project has been organized by Gabby Richardson.

mailing-address.narrative: Manchock Street, Oku, PO Box 905 Bamenda, Northwest Cameroon Cameroon

title.narrative: Re-equip 200 women during & after Covid19 in Kenya

description.narrative: Imagine being part of a team that equips a mother, economically destroyed by Covid 19, with skills that will enable her to place a plate of food again for their hungry children daily! Your 10, 20, 50, or 1000 dollar-contribution will just do that! This women project aims at training in tailoring, fashion and design skills in Kware slums, Kajiado County, Kenya. It targets 200 women from highly needy families who will open their own small tailoring shops or be employed upon graduating.

mailing-address.narrative: Ongata Rongai Nairobi 1113-00208 Ngong Kenya

title.narrative: Funding Frontline COVID-19 Response in Kibera

description.narrative: Though the COVID-19 pandemic has affected nearly every person in the world in some way, those living in informal settlements like Kibera continue to experience challenges disproportionately. Carolina for Kibera (CFK) staff has been on the frontlines addressing the COVID-19 pandemic since the first confirmed case in Kenya in March 2020. From combatting misconceptions to improving contact tracing, our local staff has developed a coordinated and tailored response to the COVID-19 pandemic in Kibera.

mailing-address.narrative: FedEx Global Education Center UNC-Chapel Hill Campus Box 5145 CB#5145 Chapel Hill, North Carolina 27599 United States

title.narrative: Give to stop the spread of coronavirus and COVID19

description.narrative: Coronavirus is spreading rapidly among our community due to other cultural beliefs we had in our country like hand shaking when greeting each other, staying closer in funeral ceremonies, Engagement and Wedding ceremonies, Initiation ceremonies and the way out Orphans and other Vulnerable person's are sharing their staying and sleeping rooms. Some of these Malawian cultures need to be stopped and the supply of some material that i helps in preventing the spread of coronavirus has to increasing

mailing-address.narrative: P.O Box 165 Lunzu Lunzu Chilangoma Chinseu Dzimbiri GVH Mdala Blantyre, Malawi 265 Malawi

description.narrative: Healthcare professionals are our essential defense on the front lines against deadly infectious diseases such as COVID 19, and they are operating under tremendous strain to provide quality care to a surging number of patients. We aim to protect them from the harmful effects of chronic stress in these trying times by giving them skills to better manage stress and difficult emotions, strengthen their interpersonal relationships, cultivate emotional resilience and improve their mental well-being.

mailing-address.narrative: Avenida Tamaulipas 236 502 Hipodromo, Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, CDMX 06100 Mexico

title.narrative: 1m meals for excluded women & children in Covid-19

description.narrative: We are distributing essential medicines, millions of meals, school supplies and coordinating vaccination, oxygen and hospital referrals for children and women in red light areas, refugee camps and migrant slums hit by Covid-19 in India. They have lost access to food as Covid has taken life and livelihoods. Children sent back from school are in small rooms with no windows. Food and fresh air are a luxury let alone wi-fi and computers for online education. We are giving children computers too

mailing-address.narrative: 420 East 51st office D New York, NY 10022 United States

description.narrative: This project aims to protect our partner communities who have limited access to preventative resources from the rapidly spreading COVID-19. With poor access to healthcare, running water and sanitary supplies or facilities, these communities are largely unable to protect themselves from the virus. By urgently implementing on-the-ground interventions that include Tippy Taps and soap, face masks and poultry distribution, we aim to reduce the transmission and economic impact of COVID-19.

mailing-address.narrative: 63 Heyman Road Suburbs Bulawayo, Bulawayo 00000 Zimbabwe

description.narrative: The aim of this project is to feed the jobless daily wage workers and their families during the time of COVID-19 pandemic. Taking into consideration the current situation, we will be regularly providing food packets and hygiene kits to these families for two months. This will help support these families basic needs in their critical times.

mailing-address.narrative: ISKCON Prayagraj, A161 Kashiraj Nagar, Baluaghat Prayagraj, Uttar Pradesh 211003 India

description.narrative: Like everyone we didn't see COVID-19 coming. As a charity we have spent the first five months of this pandemic focused on emergency relief for all our projects around the world. Now we are for the first time ever faced with the challenge that our ongoing costs are higher than we can afford. It costs us $5,000 a month to run our office, team, accounting and for the first time ever we need your help.

mailing-address.narrative: International House 12 Constance Street London, London E16 2DQ United Kingdom

title.narrative: How Pilares works during the pandemic of COVID19

description.narrative: The aim of this project is that you know how we are working in the coronavirus pandemic with children who live in vulnerable conditions in slums of Buenos Airescity. As a Foundation, Pilares have been working very close with families, and the pandemic has challenge us. We have to transform all our activities and proposals for families to a virtual scheme. By helping us, you are contribute to help families with nurturing products and cleaning products in order to help them to face COVID 19.

organisation.narrative: Pilares (Fundacion Accion Pais para la Formacion de Liderazgo Social)

mailing-address.narrative: Godoy Cruz 1653, PH 2 Ciudad Autonoma de Buenos Aires, CABA 1414 Argentina

title.narrative: COVID-19 Relief Funds for Women-Led Non-Profits

description.narrative: The WomenLead Institute (WLI) strengthens the leadership and management skills of women leaders around the world-- women who run the local organizations that people turn to in times of crises. Now, with COVID-19, they too are in crisis. The project funds will be awarded to the highly committed and locally trusted graduates of our leadership programs so they can continue to support their communities and beneficiaries and adapt their programming to respond during, and beyond, the pandemic.

mailing-address.narrative: 2345 Crystal Dr., Suite 301 Arlington, VA 22202 United States

title.narrative: Support Education for Girls Affected by COVID-19

description.narrative: This project will encourage and uphold academic excellence for 16 girls in Kenya by providing them with consistent support, professional mentoring, counselling, safe housing and individualized tutoring.

mailing-address.narrative: 3332 Brentwood Ave El Sobrante, CA 94803 United States

title.narrative: Provide Safe School for Girls in Monrovia, Liberia

description.narrative: Hilltop Schools operates a girls Academy to ensure girls attend school and become leaders in their community. The Academy has a holistic approach, providing 260 girls quality education, healthcare, nutrition, and psychosocial support. School for our students is entirely free. Your donation goes towards learning materials, social work programs, extracurricular activities, leadership training, daily meals, and retrofitting classrooms to fit COVID-19 safety and distancing protocols.

mailing-address.narrative: Old Budget Bureau Road Monrovia, Capital Hill NA Liberia

title.narrative: THE SEND A SEED WOMEN'S PROJECT; KABALE -UGANDA

description.narrative: The Send a Seed Women's project in Kabale Uganda is aimed at sustaining the indigenous good seeds and utilizing seeds not only as food sources but also as an income generating project for the families involved.Also natural manure and other forms of organic manure are use,and not artificial manure, to increase soil fertility.In times of COVID-19 pandemic,nutritious food is essential.

organisation.narrative: Industrial Workers of the world Kabale Uganda

title.narrative: COVID-19 Prevention and Recovery Fund in DR Congo

description.narrative: COVID-19 is an unexpected global health and humanitarian emergency. It threatens to create devastating social, economic, and political crises that could leave deep scars for years to come, putting at risk the lives and livelihoods of billions of people. Your donation to this Fund will help prevent the pandemic and alleviate the suffering of vulnerable groups in Congo-Kinshasa by promoting an hygiene at home and schools as well as providing food to hungry children and impacted families.

mailing-address.narrative: Immeuble RYAN, 3eme Niveau, 4 Avenue du Marche, Commune de la Gombe Kinshasa, Kinshasa 981 Kinshasa 1 Congo, Democratic Republic of the

title.narrative: Hygiene Kits to Prevent COVID-19 in Nicaragua

description.narrative: The recent COVID-19 outbreak has worsened the economic struggles of Managua street vendors who put themselves at risk to earn a living and rely on a daily income to survive. This project will distribute hygiene kits and education resources to economically vulnerable street vendors to provide them with the necessary resources to face the current pandemic, as well as to increase the awareness on preventing the transmission of the virus.

mailing-address.narrative: Calle de Ruben Dario Billares Lacayo 75m al Oeste Leon, Leon 21000 Nicaragua

title.narrative: ECONOMIC RESCUE FOR 1000 VULNERABLE WOMEN, IGANGA

description.narrative: Women mainly those in urban and peri urban areas have been the most affected by the Covid 19 pandemic that caused more health, social and economic mayhem. Uganda women were hit hard as some workplaces are still closed wrecking women livelihoods. Will engage government and other stakeholders on absorbing women mainly those who lost their jobs and livelihoods, Create awareness on women's rights, policy frameworks on gender equality, empower women economically and advocate for gender equality.

organisation.narrative: HARAMBEE YOUTH MENTORSHIP AND HEALTH ADVOCACY (HAYMHA)

title.narrative: HELP FEED 50 POOR GURUKUL STUDENTS IN INDIA(COVID)

description.narrative: We have a Gurukul of 50 resident students at Varanasi, India. The Gurukul provides free food, stay, education and basic necessities to these students, most of whom have no source of income as dedicated individuals. The Gurukul runs on donations from local people. However, with the outbreak of COVID-19 pandemic, funds have become scarce. The donations have reduced to almost nil since March 2020. With depleting resources, we need urgent help to feed and sustain our resident students & teachers.

mailing-address.narrative: ISKCON Prayagraj, A161 Kashiraj Nagar, Baluaghat Prayagraj, Uttar Pradesh 211003 India

description.narrative: With the outbreak of COVID-19, the economy of world has drastically declined. In under-developed areas like ours, orphans and needy people are put in difficulty in a struggle for basic elements of life. As a part of our national project "Food for Life", our team at ISKCON India will be supporting the local orphanages in feeding the much needed nutritious food to orphanage kids and nearby villagers in the city of Varanasi, India.

mailing-address.narrative: ISKCON Prayagraj, A161 Kashiraj Nagar, Baluaghat Prayagraj, Uttar Pradesh 211003 India

description.narrative: Our students have stopped attending school due to COVID-19. This project's goal to help the children from our school to complete their education online. We will bring internet to their households and help their families as well.

organisation.narrative: FUNDACION AMPARO Y FORMACION PADRE JOSE KENTENICH dba FUNDACION NINOS DE MARIA

title.narrative: GIVING HOPE TO 60 STAFF AFFECTED BY COVID-19

description.narrative: From 15th March 2020 when the Kenyan Government abruptly closed all the schools due to COVID-19 pandemic, 60 members of our staff from the two locations where we are currently operating (Nairobi and Kisumu counties) were also sent home abruptly. From that time it has been extremely hard to survive for these staff whose only hope was the compensation from our organization. This project appeal to our well-wishers to help raise US$18,000 to assist our affected staff for six months.

mailing-address.narrative: P.O. Box 4544-00200 NAIROBI 00200 Kenya

title.narrative: Prevent COVID-19:SODIS Promotes Hygiene in Bolivia

description.narrative: "COVID-19 as the worlds most dangerous threat"UNICEF (2020) Children experience poverty differently from adults. Their needs, expectations, and aspirations are different. It is therefore important to directly assess their material shortcomings, or measure their multidimensional poverty. Nevertheless, in the context of the current COVID-19 pandemic, as parents lose their jobs and sources of income, it is also important to measure what happens to children living in monetary poor and impoverished

mailing-address.narrative: Calle Jack London 483 y William Shakespeare Temporal Cochabamba, Cochabamba n/d Bolivia

description.narrative: In Gulu, Uganda, corona virus is spreading fast within the city and in the surrounding communities. The district has no ventilator which means patients in need of intensive care cannot be saved. The long-lasting lockdown measures made a big dent in the livelihoods of people, leading to poverty and hopelessness. CEOU is installing hand wash equipment in public places and translating government approved information into local languages to help people understand and implement prevention measures.

mailing-address.narrative: P O Box 29, Gulu-Uganda Plot 12 Peter Paul Opok Rd Gulu 256 Uganda

title.narrative: IRIDA-A Safe Space for 500 Refugee women in Greece

description.narrative: IRIDA supports refugee, migrant & local women who are among the most vulnerable during the Covid-19 pandemic. We are a community of 500 members from 37 countries. We provide individualized psycho-social support, protection services, legal counseling, based on our members' unique needs. We give the opportunity to refugee and asylum-seeking women to develop their skills and access language & literacy classes, employability training, recreational activities, and a strong community network.

mailing-address.narrative: 59 El. Venizelou Thessaloniki 54631 Greece

title.narrative: Emergency Response to the Coronavirus in Yemen

description.narrative: Yemen is suffering from the worst humanitarian crisis in a century. Before COVID-19, the country was already fighting a cholera epidemic, famine, and the effects of civil war. As a result, the UN says that coronavirus could spread "faster, wider, and with deadlier consequences in Yemen than many other countries in the world. Your donation goes towards the Yemen Emergency Relief Fund. This fund provides healthcare equipment, supplies & treatment as well as food & water to vulnerable people.

mailing-address.narrative: 10604 Southwest Highway, Suite 107 Chicago Ridge, IL 60415 United States

title.narrative: Computers & Tablets for virtual ed. in Colombia

description.narrative: Access to education in Cartagena, COLOMBIA is in a critical state as the COVID outbreak has fully pushed the education system to virtuality and most of the kids that attend the 431 public schools don't have the proper equipment to access internet. We need to get as many laptops and tablets as possible to fill these needs. We will provide 6 and 7yo with tablets and 8-18yo with laptops. Our initial goal are the children of the communities we serve in FEM, and any extras to the public school system

mailing-address.narrative: Calle 32 #8-11 Of 515 La Matuna Cartagena, Bolivar 111311 Colombia

title.narrative: Support 105 children with special needs in Uganda

description.narrative: Children with special needs especially those suffering from cerebral palsy, Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) and other physical and mental handicaps need to be supported in order to reach their potential and that is what Lala's Children Support Organisation has been doing for some time now. We have seen several children's ways of living improved. More than ever, we need your urgent assistance in continuing to help these children especially through the post covid 19 era.

mailing-address.narrative: Lalas Near Doctor's Hospital Seguku,Entebbe Road Lala's Day Care Seguku,Plot No.224 Kampala 256 Uganda

description.narrative: The situation in Lebanon is heartbreaking! Thousands of people have been severely wounded in a huge blast that ripped through Lebanon's capital, Beirut, and the number of deaths is still rising. Hospitals are working overcapacity and some parts of hospitals destroyed. Rafic Hariri Hospital Hospital is already on the verge of declaring its inability to accommodate patients due to COVID 19. It's reported that a wheat storage facility has been completely destroyed. What's next?

organisation.narrative: Union of Relief and Development Associations

mailing-address.narrative: Mount Lebanon, khaldeh, behind Al Rammal Supermarket , Al Anwar building, ground floor Beirut 5362 Lebanon

description.narrative: In times of crisis, the most vulnerable in society are most affected. At MS Ireland we've been working hard to provide support to those living with MS. Our work hasn't and won't stop. But we need your help to continue. We are currently providing online services that include a range of online programmes such as physiotherapy classes,yoga, webinars, mindfulness programmes, virtual face to face support, and an extension of the MS information line hours.

mailing-address.narrative: 80 Northumberland Road, Ballsbridge Dublin 4 Dublin 0000 Ireland

title.narrative: COVID-19 Prevention and Control in Ethiopia

description.narrative: Orbis is on a mission to prevent and control COVID-19 in Ethiopia and we need your help. Teaching the importance of hand washing is at the heart of what we do at Orbis, to prevent eye diseases such as Trachoma. Such personal hygiene practices are also key in preventing the spread of COVID-19. This project will provide key COVID-19 messaging and hygiene supplies across a region of 3.4 million people.

mailing-address.narrative: 20-21 St Patrick's Road Dalkey Dublin,, Dublin A96 DV76 Ireland

title.narrative: Standing Hand in Hand with Beirut

description.narrative: The situation in Lebanon is heartbreaking! Thousands of people have been severely wounded in a huge blast that ripped through Lebanon's capital, Beirut, and the number of deaths is still rising. Hospitals are working overcapacity and some parts of hospitals destroyed. Rafic Hariri Hospital Hospital is already on the verge of declaring its inability to accommodate patients due to COVID 19. It's reported that a wheat storage facility has been completely destroyed.

mailing-address.narrative: Abdul Majid Bazzi Bldg.- 1st floor- Saray St.-Saida-Lebanon Saida, South Saida 607 Lebanon

title.narrative: Sustainability & Food Security for the Amazon-BR

description.narrative: The Amazon is the largest remaining rain forest, producing most of the world's oxygen and 1/5 of its freshwater. Deforestation, poverty and COVID-19 are destroying the region and its indigenous people. This project will build an Aquaponics Center of Excellence to strengthen food security, economic recovery and sustainable livelihoods for indigenous and traditional peoples in 9 regions of the Amazon, while protecting critical habitat and biodiversity.

mailing-address.narrative: 21630 Ridgetop Circle, Suite 130 Sterling, VA 20166 United States

title.narrative: Arts as our bridge to Equity during COVID-19

description.narrative: The goal of Story Tapestries has always been to engage at-risk, high-need communities using the arts as the tool for meeting objectives in Literacy, STEAM, Social-Emotional, Self and Community development. Our greatest strength has been our ability to custom-design programs to meet the specific needs of a community. This has taken on new meaning as our global community and local residents in the Greater Washington Region and across Maryland are coping with the spread of COVID-19.

mailing-address.narrative: 13641 Winterspoon Lane Germantown, MD 20874 United States

title.narrative: Virtual Learning support in WA Boys & Girls Clubs

description.narrative: This Fall families throughout WA State will have to find new ways to support their kids' learning with schools going virtual due to COVID-19. WA Boys & Girls Clubs are here to help students with all-day programs that facilitate distance learning with dedicated spaces, professional staff, meals and snacks, and school supplies. Your support will ensure that kids from challenging socio-economic situations, where parents must work, have the support they need to excel in school, #whateverittakes!

mailing-address.narrative: P.O. Box 1774 Olympia, WA 98507 United States

title.narrative: GIVING A SMILE THROUGH A PACKET OF DIGNITY!

description.narrative: This project will provide 2 free sanitary pads packets per month and 4 inner wear to 250 girls (11-20 years old) living in urban poor settings, whose families income streams are drastically affected by the Covid-19 pandemic With schools closed, and opportunities for free pads access gone,majority have resulted to domestic servitude, sexual exploitation and selling of worms to fishermen/women to buy one packet of pads at $0.50. The fund will cover the cost of 1 packet of sanitary napkin @ $0.50

mailing-address.narrative: DIPLOMAT HOUSE 3rd Floor: MAMA NGINA STREET BOX 1639-20117, NAIVASHA Box 1639 Naivasha, Naivasha 20117 Kenya

description.narrative: The IRC emergency unit has launched an immediate response in Lebanon. The IRC will provide immediate cash and economic assistance to those impacted and displaced by the explosion in Beirut. The explosion - which killed 137 people and wounded 5,000 as of August 6th - has left an additional 300,000 people displaced. This devastation comes on top of an already looming threat of economic collapse, and threat of increasing scarcity of food connected to the COVID-19 outbreak.

mailing-address.narrative: 122 East 42nd Street New York, NY 10168 United States

description.narrative: Project funds will be directed to the hospital staff at St. John's Hospital and Rizk Hospital, as well as the Maronite Missionary Church, to be used to alleviate the local health care providers' most urgent needs following the devastating port explosion on August 4th. Lebanon was suffering a major economic crisis and shortage of medical supplies, equipment and PPE supplies amid the COVID pandemic before the explosion in Beirut on August 4th.

mailing-address.narrative: 23917 Cass Avenue, Suite B Farmington, MI 48835 United States

title.narrative: Monetary support for children with Down syndrome

description.narrative: KDSP's Network includes more than 860 families who have children with Down syndrome. Existing unfavorable economic conditions and more recently, COVID-19 has created immense difficulties for 150 of these families to sustain basic household necessities. KDSP is providing monetary support to these families every month, since April 2020, in the form of grocery bags and cash transfers to help ease their difficulties.

mailing-address.narrative: KDSP Office Suite no. 102, First Floor Jason Trade Centre, Shahra-e-Faisal Karachi 75400 Pakistan

title.narrative: COVID.Emergency food aid for informal settlements

description.narrative: -We have currently delivered more than 35,000 kits- The measures taken to prevent the contagion of COVID-19 have differential consequences for the inhabitants of informal settlements: the cancellation of classes has made children and adolescents lose school meals, which are a fundamental part of their diet, on the other hand. The impossibility of going out to work, the high rate of informal employment and unemployment, add to these consequences that put the nutrition of entire families at risk.

organisation.narrative: Un Techo para mi Pais Colombia

mailing-address.narrative: Kr 28 # 53a 53 Bogota 111311 Colombia

title.narrative: End Period Poverty for 200 Girls in Kafue, Zambia

description.narrative: COVID-19 is making period poverty worse worldwide. At a time when AEP's girls in Zambia are in most need of menstrual empowerment, our youth center remains closed due to the pandemic. In a recent poll, 30% of our girls reported using rags or traditional methods during their period. 72% said they would try a menstrual cup. Your support of this project will provide 200 girls with a menstrual health home check-in and training. Each girl will receive a pack of five reusable pads and a menstrual cup.

mailing-address.narrative: PO Box 6 Wayne, PA 19087 United States

description.narrative: Due to the Covid-19 pandemic, ASHTAR Theatre started presenting its productions free for the audience online on its social media platforms, in order to keep the link with its audience and students alive and vibrant. After 6 months of quarantine and zero live cultural events, and null support from the Palestinian Government towards the art and artists; ASHTAR is trying to compensate the loss of its tickets sale through an online crowd funding.

organisation.narrative: ASHTAR for Theatre Productions and Training

mailing-address.narrative: Sunrise Building, Al Irsal Street Al Irsal Street Ramallah 602 Palestine

description.narrative: Covid 19 has changed who nonprofits transact business and we here at Infinite Hands initiatives Koats4Kids will prepackage a new coat and gloves, 7 pairs of socks and a new poncho to the children housed at the chosen nonprofit and those placed in foster care. Its extremely important to get these new warm items to children in need. Your donations are greatly appreciated.

mailing-address.narrative: PO Box 572 Friendswood, TX 77546 United States

title.narrative: Stop Early and Unplanned Pregnancy in Africa

description.narrative: Since 2018, PCI Media's Let's Talk campaign has helped reduce unintended pregnancy in 21 countries across Southern and Eastern Africa through classroom and public dialogue that educates young people about sexual and reproductive choices. Unfortunately, the COVID-19 pandemic has halted these in-person programs. With your support, we can pivot Let's Talk to reach girls and boys through social media, radio dramas and call-in shows that would create a safe space at home for girls and young women.

mailing-address.narrative: 26 Broadway Suite 934 New York, New York 10004 United States

title.narrative: TogetherWeCan: Medical food for Palestine PKU Kids

description.narrative: Over 580 children in Gaza & the West Bank suffer from Phenylketonuria (PKU), a genetic disorder. Kids with PKU are unable to metabolize protein. The COVID-19 emergency + elimination of US aid to Palestine halted access to specialized medical food. Each child needs 6 cans/mo. Our 2 shipments only partially met their needs, so we're teaming up in a TogetherWeCan program to provide reliable delivery until the governments resume responsibility. Please make a recurring donation & ask friends to join.

mailing-address.narrative: 50 Woodside Road Ste. 627 Redwood City, CA 94061 United States

description.narrative: Guatemala is one of the poorest countries in the region, and one of the countries with the smallest state structures in the world. This results in an absent state in the majority of the country territory, and many of the most basic needs unattended. The depicted situation is not new but the irruption of the COVID-19 pandemic has aggravated the social urgent needs. With our workshop we seek to empower rural communities to develop local solutions for local challenges.

organisation.narrative: Asociacion para el Liderazgo en Guatemala

mailing-address.narrative: 1ra Avenida Norte #12 La Antigua Guatemala 03001 Guatemala

title.narrative: Birth Kits for Refugees at Thai-Myanmar Border

description.narrative: This project is to provide Myanmar refugees and marginalized people with antenatal care, essential medication and birth kits for safe home delivery. They cannot access appropriate healthcare services due to the Thai-Myanmar border closure caused by COVID-19 lockdown and numerous barriers. GCS would supply antenatal care visit screening and birth kits for pregnant women in hard-to-reach area. Also, GCS supports birth registration fee for newborns to get basic social service as global citizens.

mailing-address.narrative: #901 Gardentower, 84 Youlgok-ro, Jongno-gu, Seoul, Korea Seoul, Jongno 03131 South Korea
